content.description: Start with wide hands and feet on blocks below. Use the crack and potentially a tight fingerlock to stand up on the face. Topout up and left. Currently there is a terrifyingly large fallen tree overtop of this, but it doesnt stop you from toppoing out. Climb at your own discretion.Have a strong spotter to keep you from tumbling off the small landing pedestal.
content.location: Above Spacklehead and left of Flapper.

content.description: Start left hand on the slopey rail and right hand on a small crimp on the face. Move out left for a couple moves, then back right for a tricky mantle over the lip to top out. Topping out left is easier (v3) and up the middle will likely be the hardest, but is still a project.
content.location: If facing "Easy street" on spacklehead boulder, continue on trail past the boulder for approx. 25 yards and it's slightly uphill.

content.description: Start with hands on the incut dimple at the lip of the overhang and/or on the right arete. All surrounding blocks are off. Get a high smeary foot onto the lip and use a devilish sidepull to work up to a positive flake far  up the face. Be gentle with the flake, I don't fully trust its integrity.
content.location: The overhanging boulder uphill from the spacklehead boulder. The landing is a bit questionable without a spotter.

content.description: Use large holds and smeary feet to climb the short corner.
content.location: The boulder directly downhill from the Spacklehead boulder.

content.description: The low sit start to Backboard [V0]. Start in wide compression on both corners, smearing feet to stay on. Slap your way into a more secure stance and climb up.
Sit start with smeary feet and a good flat hand hold. Follow obvious holds straight up.
content.location: The small pointed boulder that seems to have a "backboard" boulder creating a good landing that would otherwise mean a tumble downhill.

content.description: Sit-start compressing both arete, with creative feet. Do a couple bumps up the corners until you get a good hold over the top of the lip. Follow good holds up and right until you can top out.
content.location: Hike down the hill until you hit the old railroad bed below the spacklehead boulder. Walk downstream on the railroad grade for a couple minutes. After passing some dirty slabs on your right, look up the hill for the boulder.

content.description: A place for the scattered small boulders with only single problems on them.
